OOC: Boy it's been a really BUSY day. i will try to get a new post out
tomm=
orrow or Friday. But just some things that Night Shift and Rat Trap
should =
be aware of:

Communication with Cheetor was lost while he was near the Hyd=
ras' base,
which is many hundreds of miles from Night Shift's and Ratrap's =
current
location . . . unless they are willing to risk a trip back to the l=
ocation
that the Black Tower USED to stand :)

Also as to loosing the sweep=
s, or the assumption that they would believe
that Nightshift has crashed. I=
t is common knowledge that sweeps, as a group,
have about the best tracking=
 gear among the Decepticon/predacon forces, and
they themselves are designe=
d as scouring vehicles whos focus is to find and
locate survivors or runawa=
ys.

Here is an excerpt on Scourge's profile, which also applies a lesser e=
xtent
the sweeps . . .

"Scourge is possessed of scanning and locating equi=
pment, which can detect
machine or human presence even if it is as small as=
 an amoeba in the ocean
or a wind-up toy in the Sahara desert. "

I just wa=
nted to give you some insight as to the sweeps as an FYI. The
sweeps cannot=
 SEE the Maximals under the cover of the forest that they are
in, but then =
again Night Shift and Rat Trap cannot see if the Sweeps have
left either. H=
owever as any Maximal might note, it would be dangerous to
assume that they=
 have lost complete track of them, especially since the
sweeps cannot thems=
elves be scanned.

Preston


 On Tue, Mar 29, 2011 at 12:22 PM, Sandy <magi=
cquartz@...> wrote:
>
>

> Out of the frying pan and into the fire. =
Night Shift slows himself down
considerably now navigating through harsh te=
rrain. High beams are put on as
he slows his roll down to a crawl, and then=
 stops.

> " I could continue but I'd rather not risk the tires. I only go=
t one spare
left. Time for robot mode little buddy."
>

 as Night Shift takes to robot mode.
>
> "I just thought of somethn'.. Chee=
tor, we dunno whatever happened ta him."

>
> =
"You're right, we don't. My com link's not gettn' any signals. I
wonder..."=

>
> Rat Trap sighs.
>

lls me we should see if
he's here."

tly what we're gonna do. Besides, those airheads probably
think we've gotte=
n wrecked big time. So why not continue the illusion?"
>

>

than havn' those airheads blastn' the fuzz off my tail end."
>

they walk into the dense overgrowth, exploring its parameters
with what lit=
tle light comes from Night Shift's high beams.
>

akes his way toward Rodimus's position, while
keeping close tabs on the sig=
nal he's able to work with, as faint as it is.
He also picks up on Rodimus =
as he now approaches him quietly.
>
> " I take it you've picked up on Night=
razor's trail. Well, he's checked
himself in but he won't check himself out=
. His signatures are fluctuating,
which means he's trying to recalibrate hi=
s systems. Hense he's also
distracted. Good time to apprehend him. All righ=
t, I'm going in, but before
I do, I used my last pair of stasis cuffs, woul=
d you by chance have another
I could borrow?"

> Straight Shot now transfo=
rms into her robot mode.
>

son looks to her.

lities, and his
weaponry, by removing the cards that enable them. We'll sec=
ure those cards
in the vault under maximum security. Then, we will bring hi=
m back online,
and hopefully get some answers out of him. After that though=
, he remains in
our custody under Maximum security. When all is said and do=
ne, Rodimus, I'd
like to meet with you and the rest, as to how we're going =
to deal with
Nightrazor appropriately."
>
> Straight Shot nodds.
>

s good ta me. That should make Hydras squirm."
>
> Outside, Uproar and Quic=
kstride notice that things are turning difficult
for Leo and the other maxi=
mals. Uproar gets into robot mode, as he looks to
Quickstride who does the =
same thing.
>
> Uproar ejects his claws to full length, and glances over to=
 his comrade.
>
> " You go for Waspinator, I'll go for Cyclonus."
>
> Quick=
stride eyes him.
>
> " Right, I've always wanted ta give that bug a good sw=
atting. Now's my
chance."
>

o deal with their intended
opponents.
>

lonus while leaping into the air on
strong legs.
>

>
> He ra=
ises his left arm to attempt a powerful claw swipe.
>

ide calibrates his large blast cannon, and takes
careful aim at Waspinator.=
 He chuckles under his breath.
>
> " Bye bye BUGGIE!"
>
> His finger pulls =
back on the trigger, as he now attempts to shoot
Waspinator down.
